text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the determination of whether the drunk driver's actions were an intervening cause is partially dependent on how long the chair was in the road prior to the swerving (to determine whether the drunk driver could reasonably have seen the chair in time to avoid it without swerving). The candidate answer discusses intervening causes (the truck driver's negligence and the second driver's actions) but does not mention the time the chair was in the road as a factor in assessing the reasonableness of the swerve or whether the driver could have avoided it differently. It focuses instead on the foreseeability of the truck driver's negligence and the foreseeability of the second driver's reaction.", "criterion_id": "53430ddb-2da1-464a-af19-ff799ad6064e"}
